sentence.Network_en: Jenny was exhausted by the hustle of city life.
sentence.Network_cn: 珍妮被城市生活的忙乱弄得筋疲力尽.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (originally in the sense 'shake, toss'): from Middle Dutch hutselen The senses 'sell aggressively', 'swindle' were adopted from US usage.. Sense 3 dates from the early 20th cent

encyclopedia.content: 飞天大盗（Hustle），英国电视剧，导演Tony Jordan，2004年上映，至2012年一共播出八季，BBC播放，第八季已经完结。飞天大盗也是一款5人对战的警匪游戏。

entry.def: If you hustle someone, you try to make them go somewhere or do something quickly, for example by pulling or pushing them along.

example.ex: The guards hustled Harry out of the car...
example.tran: 卫兵将哈里从车里拉了出来。

example.ex: There was no opportunity to ask anything more as the guards hustled us away.
example.tran: 卫兵把我们推搡走了，我们没有机会再多问。

entry.def: If you hustle, you go somewhere or do something as quickly as you can.

example.ex: You'll have to hustle if you're to get home for supper...
example.tran: 你想赶回家吃晚饭的话，就得加快速度。

example.ex: He hustled straight up the aircraft steps without looking round or waving goodbye...
example.tran: 他急匆匆地径直登上飞机舷梯，没有环顾四周，也没有挥手告别。

entry.tran: （常指用不正当或非法的手段）谋取;骗钱;诈取
entry.def: If someone hustles, they try to earn money or gain an advantage from a situation, often by using dishonest or illegal means.

example.ex: We're expected to hustle and fight for what we want...
example.tran: 我们应该为得到自己想要的而不择手段，奋力争取。

example.ex: I hustled some tickets from a magazine and off we went.
example.tran: 我从一家杂志社骗了几张票，然后我们就一起去了。

example.ex: Shell Cottage provides the perfect retreat from the hustle and bustle of London...
example.tran: 谢尔农舍为想要躲避伦敦的忙碌喧嚣的人们提供了一个绝佳的休闲之所。

example.ex: She waited until they were beyond the hustle of the Washington Saturday night traffic.
example.tran: 她一直等到他们远离了华盛顿周六晚上的车水马龙。

means.word_mean: 1. a swindle in which you cheat at gambling or persuade a person to buy worthless property
1. cause to move furtively and hurriedly;

sentences.sentence: "The secret service agents hustled the speaker out of the amphitheater"

means.word_mean: 2. move or cause to move energetically or busily;

sentences.sentence: "The cheerleaders bustled about excitingly before their performance"

means.word_mean: 3. sell something to or obtain something from by energetic and especially underhanded activity

means.word_mean: 催促, (使)赶快, (使)迅速行动

sentences.en: I hustled the children off to school.
sentences.cn: 我催促孩子们赶快上学去。

sentences.en: He hustled me into buying the car.
sentences.cn: 他硬逼我买下那辆汽车。

sentences.en: Jenny was exhausted by the hustle of city life.
sentences.cn: 珍妮被城市生活的忙乱弄得筋疲力尽。

jushi.chinese: 他硬逼我买下那辆汽车。
